sen.j: 東園 基敬（ひがしその もとゆき、文政3年10月23日 (旧暦)（1820年11月28日） - 明治16年（1883年）5月24日）は幕末から明治時代にかけての公卿。
sen.e: Motoyuki HIGASHISONO (November 28, 1820 – May 24, 1883) was a Court noble in the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period.
Motoyuki HIGASHISONO (November 28, 1820 – May 24, 1883) was a Court noble who lived during the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period.

sen.e: In 1855, while an imperial visit by Emperor Komei, he accompanied him, with leading one toneri (palace servant), two zuijin (guard), one Kodoneri Warawa (juvenile people who served Court nobles and samurai families), and two Zoshiki (low-level functionary).

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）には岩倉らとともに廷臣八十八卿列参事件として行動し、朝廷に列参して日米修好通商条約への勅許に反対した。
sen.e: In 1858, he acted as the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court, together with IWAKURA and so, and gathered at the Imperial Court and opposed to an Imperial sanction to the Treaty of amity and commerce between the United states and Japan.

In 1858, he took part in the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court with IWAKURA and so on, and went to the Imperial Court to object to an Imperial sanction to the Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文の日本語が難解（「･･･事件として行動し」の部分）なため、took part inという表現を用いて訳文を修正致しました。また、Statesの頭部分が小文字でしたので、大文字に直しました。
sen.e: In 1858, he took part in the Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court with IWAKURA and so on, and went to the Imperial Court to object to an Imperial sanction to the Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan.

sen.j: 孝明天皇の支持も得て、幕府による条約勅許の画策を阻止した。
sen.e: He gained Emperor Komei's support, and prevented the plan of Imperial sanction to the treaty by the government.
He gained support from Emperor Komei, and blocked the government's plan on the Imperial sanction for the treaty.
